pr_title: G11n java client [BUG 754] Performance impact on the very first L3 fetch for a non-supported locale

timeline.message: Merge branch 'g11n-java-client' of github.com:jessiejuachon/singleton into g11n-java-client
Enablling locale fallback for matched locale
Merge branch 'g11n-java-client' of github.com:vmware/singleton into g11n-java-client-754
Fixing bug 754 - Performance impact on the very first L3 fetch for a non-supported locale
Merge branch 'g11n-java-client-754' of github.com:jessiejuachon/singleton into g11n-java-client-754

timeline.bodyText: Add one more test case: zh is supported, zh-Hans and zh-Hant aren't supported.  Request zh-Hant will return null rather than zh.
timeline.author: Xiaochao8
huihuiw01
huihuiw01

replies.bodyText:
I understand what you are saying. The problem with this is due to the legacy code where locale is part of the DTO. If the matched locale is not null, there are 2 possible scenarios:
a. The requested locale is a supported locale (exact match) -- lines 110-113
Here, createCacheItem in line 111 fetches the matched locale and caches it. Take note that it uses the dto's locale to generate the cache key.
b. The requested locale is not an exact match (e.g. fr-CA which is not supported matches fr which is supported) -- lines 117-118
Here, createCacheItem must be done on the supported locale (fr), not the requested locale (fr-CA). If I directly call createCacheItem for this case, the cache key will have fr-CA for the same set of fr messages, causing duplicate sets of messages in the cache, which is not good. So, call ComponentService(matchedLocaleDTO).getMessages instead.
This is why these 2 scenarios are handled differently. We can refactor this in the future and extract locale out of the DTO, but I did not want to touch that legacy code for now.
replies.author: jessiejuachon

replies.bodyText:
Can reseting dto's locale after locale matching resolve the problem you mentioned?
I think when matchedLocale is not empty, all later logic(no matter find from cache or find from data source) should use matchedLocale, request locale is useless.
replies.author: huihuiw01

timeline.bodyText: Why use fallback locale instead of 'zh'?
timeline.author: huihuiw01

replies.bodyText: It has been like that previously. I am guessing it was an old requirement.
replies.author: jessiejuachon

timeline.bodyText: We can unify this these 2 situations. If matchedLocale == null, then set locale to fallback locale. Get its translation afterwards.
timeline.author: Xiaochao8

replies.bodyText:
You have a similar comment as Huihui. Pasting my reply below:
The problem with this is due to the legacy code where locale is part of the DTO. If the matched locale is not null, there are 2 possible scenarios:
a. The requested locale is a supported locale (exact match) -- lines 110-113
Here, createCacheItem in line 111 fetches the matched locale and caches it. Take note that it uses the dto's locale to generate the cache key.
b. The requested locale is not an exact match (e.g. fr-CA which is not supported matches fr which is supported) -- lines 117-118
Here, createCacheItem must be done on the supported locale (fr), not the requested locale (fr-CA). If I directly call createCacheItem for this case, the cache key will have fr-CA for the same set of fr messages, causing duplicate sets of messages in the cache, which is not good. So, call ComponentService(matchedLocaleDTO).getMessages instead.
This is why these 2 scenarios are handled differently. We can refactor this in the future and extract locale out of the DTO, but I did not want to touch that legacy code for now.
replies.author: jessiejuachon

replies.bodyText: I think that our comments are different. I'm saying 115~120.
replies.author: Xiaochao8

replies.bodyText: I do not understand then. Could you please provide a code suggestion?
replies.author: jessiejuachon
Xiaochao8

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the code suggestion. It will work, but I think what I currently have is cleaner and has less lines of code, don't you think? Basically, your if (!dto.getLocale().equals(ConstantsKeys.SOURCE) && fallbackLocalesIter != null && fallbackLocalesIter.hasNext()) 
is a repeat of line 132 in getMessagesFallbackLocale.
replies.author: jessiejuachon

timeline.bodyText: Is it necessary to judge dto locale is same as the fallback locale?
timeline.author: Xiaochao8

replies.bodyText:
It's not necessary, but it is an improvement. If we do not check for dto.getLocale == fallback and it happens, it will just try to fetch for the dto locale again and will fail again, and move on to the next item in the queue. Nonetheless, I have added the check for optimization.
Moreover, I hsve removed the following restriction to allow falling back to SOURCE messages:
!dto.getLocale().equals(ConstantsKeys.SOURCE)
replies.author: jessiejuachon

timeline.author: Xiaochao8

replies.bodyText: I understand you want it to be more readable. There is incorrect logic in your suggestion though. It should be if (!langTag.equals("zh-Hans") && !langTag.equals("zh-Hant")) in line 160. Please review the new code.
replies.author: jessiejuachon

timeline.author: Xiaochao8
Xiaochao8

replies.author: jessiejuachon

timeline.bodyText: In this way when dto locale is 'source' and source messages not found, it will fallback to default locale.
timeline.author: huihuiw01

replies.bodyText: If dto locale is source, it means it has reached the end of the fallback queue. Hence, it won't enter the if in line 136 because  fallbackLocalesIter.hasNext() is false.
replies.author: jessiejuachon

replies.bodyText: I mean when request locale is 'source', which make dto locale is 'source'
replies.author: huihuiw01

replies.bodyText:
Do you mean the preferred locale from the user is "source"? What use case do you have in mind where locale will be "source"? I suppose "source" will only be used as fallback.
Nonetheless, if user actually sends "source" as the preferred locale and source messages are not found, then yes, it should go though the usual locale fallback queue. What is your concern with this?
replies.author: jessiejuachon

replies.bodyText: Discussed this offline. Huihui is referring to this issue which is not within the scope of this PR: #839
replies.author: jessiejuachon

timeline.message: Do Locale matching first in Componentservice.getMessages

timeline.author: Xiaochao8

Value of VIPCfg.cacheExpiredTime is -1 when value is not set in config file. This means max age from server will be used. Setting VIPCfg.cacheExpiredTime to 0 disables caching.
